metadata.Title: CVE-2018-8034 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The host name verification when using TLS with the WebSocket client was missing. It is now enabled by default. Versions Affected: Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.9, 8.5.0 to 8.5.31, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.52, and 7.0.35 to 7.0.88.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8034` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.15
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.15
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.15
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.15
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.15
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.15
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.15').
